SEARCH
Package de.happybavarian07.coolstufflib.menusystem

Klasse PlayerMenuUtility

java.lang.Object
de.happybavarian07.coolstufflib.menusystem.PlayerMenuUtility
public class PlayerMenuUtility extends Object

The PlayerMenuUtility class serves as a utility for managing and maintaining menu-related data and player-specific information. It provides functionality for data storage, setting and retrieving player-focused details, and ensures a streamlined approach to handling temporary or session-based data for menus in a Minecraft server environment.

Features:

  • Stores the UUID of the owner (player who initialized or owns this utility).
  • Allows for setting and retrieving the UUID of a target player if applicable.
  • Implements a flexible key-value storage system for managing temporary or session-specific data.
  • Provides methods for data retrieval with optional type safety and default values.
  • Supports operations to add, replace, and remove stored data entries efficiently.

Constructor:

The class provides a constructor to initialize it with the owner's UUID, which serves as a foundational reference for the utility's operations.

Key Methods:

  • getOwnerUUID() - Retrieves the UUID of the owner of this utility.
  • getOwner() - Fetches the Player corresponding to the owner's UUID.
  • getTarget() - Fetches the Player corresponding to the target's UUID, if set.
  • setTarget(Player target) - Sets the target as a Player object, automatically storing its UUID.
  • setTargetUUID(UUID targetUUID) - Directly sets the target's UUID.
  • getData(String key) - Fetches data associated with the specified key in the storage map.
  • getData(String key, Class<T> valueType) - Attempts to fetch data associated with a key and casts it to the given type.
  • getData(String key, Object defaultValue) - Retrieves data by a key, providing a fallback value when the key is not present.
  • getData(String key, Class<T> valueType, T defaultValue) - Combines type-safe casting and default return when data is unavailable.
  • setData(String key, Object value, boolean replace) - Saves data while optionally replacing existing data associated with a key.
  • addData(String key, Object value) - Adds new data unless a value is already associated with the provided key.
  • removeData(String key) - Removes data linked to a specific key.
  • replaceData(String key, Object value) - Replaces data for a key only if it exists in the storage map.
  • hasData(String key) - Checks if a specific key exists in the storage map.

Use Case:

This class is structured to facilitate menu handling in Minecraft plugins, enabling seamless data management for individual player menus. By leveraging the key-value storage and player-targeting mechanisms, developers can efficiently customize, extend, and utilize player-specific configurations and session-based data sharing.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • PlayerMenuUtility

      public PlayerMenuUtility(UUID ownerUUID)
      Constructs a new instance of PlayerMenuUtility for the specified player. This utility provides a way to interact with and manage menu-related functionality tied to a specific player.

      The ownerUUID parameter represents the UUID of the owner of this menu utility. This is used to identify the player associated with this utility object.

  • Methodendetails

    • getOwnerUUID

      public UUID getOwnerUUID()
      Retrieves the UUID of the owner associated with this instance.

      This method returns the UUID that represents the unique identifier of the owner entity for the PlayerMenuUtility

    • getOwner

      public org.bukkit.entity.Player getOwner()
      Retrieves the owner of this PlayerMenuUtility instance.

      This method uses the ownerUUID field to identify the associated player and retrieves the corresponding Player object using Bukkit.getPlayer(UUID).

      If the UUID does not correspond to an online player, this method will return null.

      Gibt zurück:
      The Player associated with the owner UUID of this instance, or null if the owner is not currently online.

    • getTarget

      public org.bukkit.entity.Player getTarget()
      Retrieves the target player associated with this PlayerMenuUtility instance.

      This method uses the UUID stored in the targetUUID field to identify the targeted player. It then retrieves the corresponding Player object using Bukkit.getPlayer(UUID).

      Note that this method will return null if the target UUID does not correspond to an online player or if no target UUID has been set.

      Gibt zurück:
      The Player instance associated with the target UUID of this instance, or null if the target is not currently online or no target has been set.

    • getTargetUUID

      public UUID getTargetUUID()
      Retrieves the UUID representing the current target associated with this PlayerMenuUtility.

      This method provides access to the value stored in the targetUUID field, which represents the unique identifier of the target player or entity in the context of this utility.

      Gibt zurück:
      The UUID of the target associated with this instance, or null if no target has been set.

    • setTarget

      public void setTarget(org.bukkit.entity.Player target)
      Sets the target of this PlayerMenuUtility instance to the specified player.

      This method assigns the unique identifier (UUID) of the provided Player to the internal targetUUID field, which represents the player that is the target of this utility in the given context.

      Parameter:
      target - The Player instance to set as the target. Must not be null.

    • setTargetUUID

      public void setTargetUUID(UUID targetUUID)
      Sets the target UUID for the current instance.

      This method assigns the provided UUID to the targetUUID field, which is intended to represent the target player or entity in the associated context.

      Parameter:
      targetUUID - The UUID of the target to be stored.

    • getData

      public Object getData(String key)
      Retrieves the data associated with the specified key from the data map.

      This method is used to fetch a value stored in the internal data structure by providing the corresponding key.

      Parameter:
      key - The key used to identify the data to retrieve.
      Gibt zurück:
      The value associated with the provided key, or null if the key does not

    • getData

      public <T> T getData(String key, Class<T> valueType)
      Retrieves a value from the internal data storage and attempts to cast it to the specified type.

      The method fetches the value associated with the provided key and ensures that its type matches the specified valueType. If the value cannot be cast to the specified type or does not exist, the method returns null.

      Parameter:
      key - The key to identify the value in the internal data

    • getData

      public Object getData(String key, Object defaultValue)
      Retrieves a value associated with the specified key from the internal data map, or returns the provided default value if the key does not exist.

      This method provides a way to safely retrieve data entries from the internal storage while ensuring a fallback value is provided if the requested key is not found.

      Parameter:
      key - The key used to identify the data to retrieve. Must not be null.
      defaultValue - The value to return if the key does not exist in the data map.
      Gibt zurück:
      The value associated with the provided key, or the defaultValue if the key does not exist in the data map.

    • getData

      public <T> T getData(String key, Class<T> valueType, T defaultValue)
      Retrieves data associated with a specified key, casting it to the desired type, or returns a default value if the data is not present or not of the expected type.

      This method allows for safe fetching and type casting of stored data.

      Typparameter:
      T - The type of the value expected to be retrieved.
      Parameter:
      key -

    • setData

      public void setData(String key, Object value, boolean replace)
      Sets a data entry in the internal data storage.

      This method allows adding or updating a key-value pair in the data map. If the replace parameter is set to true and the key already exists, the value associated with the key will be updated. Otherwise, a new entry will be added to the map if the key does not exist.

      Parameter:
      key - The key for the data entry to be added or updated.
      value - The value to be associated with the specified key.
      replace - A boolean flag indicating whether to replace the existing value if the key already exists.

    • addData

      public void addData(String key, Object value)
      Adds a new data entry to the internal data map associated with the given key, if the key does not already exist.

      This method checks if the specified key is already present in the internal data storage. If the key is not found, it inserts the provided key-value pair into the data map. If the key is already present, the method does nothing.

      Parameter:
      key - The key for the data entry to be added. Must be a non-null, unique identifier.
      value - The value to associate with the specified key. Can be any object or null.

    • removeData

      public void removeData(String key)
      Removes a data entry associated with the specified key.

      This method removes the entry associated with the provided key from the underlying data storage. If the key does not exist, the

    • replaceData

      public void replaceData(String key, Object value)
      Replaces the value associated with a specific key in the internal data storage if the key is already present.

      This method checks if the provided key exists in the data storage. If the key exists, the value associated with it will be replaced by the provided value. If the key does not exist, no operation will be performed.

    • hasData

      public boolean hasData(String key)
      Checks whether the specified key exists within the internal data storage.

      This method determines if there is an entry associated with the specified key in the internal data map.

      Parameter:
      key - The key to be checked in the internal data storage. Must not be null.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the key exists in the data storage, false otherwise.
